message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with regenerating codes, which are a type of erasure codes used in distributed storage systems. This suggests that the paper could belong to the cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing), cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture), or cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) sub-categories. The focus on improving data repair performance in distributed storage systems suggests that cs.DC and cs.DS are likely sub-categories. The use of regenerating codes suggests that cs.IT is also a likely sub-category. The cooperative repair mechanism investigated in the paper involves nodes exchanging data among themselves, which suggests that cs.NI and cs.SI are also possible sub-categories. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.NI, and cs.SI, in that order.
